techmeme.title: Google files a lawsuit in the SDNY against a group of China-based hackers that it says run the Lighthouse platform for "phishing services", stealing $1B+ (Financial Times)
JD.com says it had record sales during China's Singles' Day event, without giving transaction values, despite Chinese deflation; Alibaba hasn't released data (Jacob Gu/Bloomberg)
German chipmaker Infineon reports Q4 revenue up 1% YoY to €3.94B, vs. €3.91B est., a €231M net profit, and expects 2026 sales growth as AI demand keeps booming (Mauro Orru/Wall Street Journal)
Sources: software-focused PE firm Vista plans significant workforce cuts in the coming years as it uses AI to compile presentations, aggregate data, and more (Financial Times)
Kraken co-CEO Arjun Sethi criticizes UK crypto promotion rules requiring clear risk warnings, saying they hinder retail investors by slowing fund movement (Nikou Asgari/Financial Times)
